title: Administrative Officer Job at Lington & Bernie Consulting Limited
content:
Lington & Bernie Consulting Limited was established on October 8, 1999 to provide efficient and qualitative consulting services to the oil and gas industry as well as banks and financial institutions in the areas of human resources placement and management, human resources consulting services, tax administration and payroll services as well as oil and gas fiscal and contractual terms advisory services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer 

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking to hire a highly organised administrative officer to perform all administrative and clerical duties necessary for effective office management.


Responsibilities


	Receiving and processing communication channels, including email, phone, and physical mail.
	Organising and managing schedules and calendars for staff
	Ensure functionality of necessary office equipment, and requisition of new equipment and supplies as needed.
	Creating reports and memos.
	Systematically filing important company documents.
	Forwarding all correspondence, such as letters and packages, to staff members.
	Hiring maintenance vendors to repair or replace damaged office equipment.
	Offer other assistance as requested


Requirements


	Minimum of HND or B.Sc degree in a relevant field.
	2 - 4 years of experience is required for this position.
	Working knowledge of necessary productivity tools, including Microsoft Office Suite.
	Proven experience being able to handle multiple tasks at the same time.
	The ideal candidate should be between 20 – 30 years.
	Candidate must reside close to Lagos Island (Obalende, Ikoyi, CMS, V.I. etc). Proximity to the office (Ikoyi) is very important because of the nature of the work


Method of Application:
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@lingtonandbernie.com using Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Preferred candidate must have integrity, be passionate, smart, healthy, resilient, hardworking and must exhibit broad and wide thinking skills.

title: Quality Control Manager (Furniture Manufacturing) Job at LD&D Consulting
content:
LD&D Consulting is a project management consulting firm that specialises in turning key projects into success by working collaboratively with clients and key stakeholders. Our specialist project management team consists of seasoned consultants across various industries.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We offer project management consulting, recruiting, Training and Development, HR outsourcing, and payroll servicesacross various industries, including Telecoms, IT, Construction, Transportation, Energy, Sports, Environmental and Health care, Banking & Finance, Services, and Consulting in both private and public sectors. We provide the best candidates for your recruiting needs by leveraging 25 years of experience working in various industries and closely working with you to understand your requirements.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Manager (Furniture Manufacturing)

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Quality Control Manager to oversee and ensure the quality standards of all furniture produced at our factory.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong background in the furniture production industry and a keen eye for identifying defects, implementing improvements, and maintaining production excellence.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate quality control operations across all stages of furniture production.
	Develop and implement quality assurance policies, standards, and procedures to meet company and customer expectations.
	Inspect raw materials, in-process items, and finished products to ensure they meet required specifications and standards.
	Train and guide production staff on quality procedures, material handling, and finishing best practices.
	Monitor equipment and tools to ensure optimal performance and reduce quality deviations.
	Identify quality issues, analyze root causes, and recommend corrective actions to reduce defects and improve production consistency.
	Work closely with the production team to ensure compliance with quality standards at each stage of manufacturing.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date quality records, inspection reports, and compliance documentation.
	Communicate effectively with management regarding quality concerns, customer feedback, and continuous improvement strategies.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations as they relate to production quality.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with a minimum of 5 years’ hands-on experience in the furniture production industry, particularly in quality assurance or control roles.
	In-depth knowledge of furniture materials (wood, metal, upholstery, hardware), production techniques, and finishing processes.
	Strong attention to detail with the ability to detect flaws and irregularities.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Good leadership and team management skills.
	Effective communication skills, both verbal and written.
	Familiarity with quality control tools, checklists, and inspection processes.
	Ability to work independently and under pressure in a factory environment.


Salary


	N180,000 - N200,000 / Month (based on experience)
	Accommodation


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: precious@ldd-consulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Procurement Officer Job at Calibration and Non-Destructive Services Limited
content:
Calibration and Non-Destructive Services Limited is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We require the services of a Sourcing Officer who has a deep knowledge and experience in procurement of oil and gas equipment, and can always liaise with the clients and the vendors.


Job Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Estimate and establish cost parameter and budget for purchase
	Create and maintain good relationship with vendors/suppliers
	Make decisions in a fast-paced environment
	Maintain records of purchasing, pricing and other important data
	Review and analyze all vendors/suppliers, supply and price options
	Develop plans for purchasing equipment, services and supplies
	Develop bid proposals for contracts
	Source for prospective suppliers by making use of internet
	Maintain and update list of suppliers and their qualifications, delivery times, and potential future development

	Must be very proactive and efficient
	Good knowledge of computer e.g Excel, Word, etc.
	Excellent communication skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover Letters and Resumes to: recruitment@calibrationservicesltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Reception Engineer / Workshop Admin Job at TAK Logistics Limited
content:
TAK Logistics Limited is a top-tier transportation firm based in Port Harcourt, offering unparalleled logistics solutions to our clients. Our expertise lies in efficiently transporting cargoes from production sites to storage facilities across Nigeria, ensuring a smooth and reliable delivery process every time.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Reception Engineer / Workshop Admin

Job Location: Rivers

Responsibilities
The Reception Engineer is responsible for managing the flow of vehicles or equipment needing repair or maintenance, coordinating related tasks, and ensuring efficient operations at the front end of the repair process
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Carry out estimates for repair, contact and liaise with accident repair agents and internal departments relating to insurance claims/work.
	Ensure documentation used is current and controlled under the Quality Management System and makes contingencies for times when the Fleet Management System (FMS) is unavailable.
	Be able to complete the inventory of trucks & trailers and diagnose the parts/systems functioning so that the inventory form gives the complete picture of repairs & buildup needs to be carried out.
	Keep a record of in & out inspections carried out and maintain a record of both truck admissions and releases respectively.
	Ensure that trucks and trailers are released only after being certified by the QC Inspector/safety personnel.
	Ensure that printout of spares consumed is attached to the QC inspection form & job card, duly signed by the QC Inspector/safety personnel while releasing the truck after major overhauls, buildup and reactivations.
	Symptom-Defect analysis of articulated trucks & trailers.
	Carry out inspections of vehicles arriving on site, either for repair or reactivation (Vehicle condition survey) or brand-new vehicles for delivery.
	Carry out weekly checks on available trucks in the Workshop, ensure an up-to-date inventory of trucks inside the Workshop with their locations.
	Positively contributes to a safe work environment ensuring compliance with Health and Safety, Risk Management, Business Continuity and Safeguarding policy and procedure. Protect all personal information in adherence with the Data Protection Act 1998.
	Daily updating of admissions and releases on the FMS, liaise with Supervisors and Stores to get up-to-date status of work to ensure data on the FMS is current and accurate.
	Ensure documentation used is current and controlled under the Quality Management System and make contingencies for times when the Fleet Management System (FMS) is unavailable.
	Any other duties commensurate with the responsibilities and grading of the post.


Requirements


	BSc Degree / HND in Automobile/Mechanical Engineering.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience of physically handling or supervising the repairs/buildup of Articulated Trucks & Trailers.
	Experience in automobile quality inspections is desirable.
	Exposure to FMS and Advanced MS Office will be an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: humanresources@ilsfleetmgt.com using the Job Position as th subject of their mail.

title: Internal Control Officer Job at Teal Harmony Nigeria Limited
content:
Teal Harmony Nigeria Limited is an interior design and renovation firm with a principal focus of providing cutting edge design solutions for private, business and commercial projects. We have grown over the years, providing services in Interior design, Interior Architecture, Consultation, Project Management, Furniture Production and Retail experience earning our place as an innovative, forward thinking interior design firm in Nigeria, our vision was built for noble intention, to be a yellow-page for interior design needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Control Officer
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for an experienced Internal Control Officer to oversee and strengthen the internal control processes within our production and retail operations.
	The ideal candidate will ensure compliance, mitigate risks, and enhance operational efficiency in our architectural and interior design firm.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement internal control policies and procedures for production and retail outlets.
	Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with financial and operational standards.
	Identify and address risks in production processes and retail transactions.
	Monitor inventory controls, ensuring accuracy in stock levels and material usage.
	Collaborate with management to improve internal processes and safeguard company assets.
	Prepare detailed reports on control findings and recommend corrective actions.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, or a related field.
	3–5 years of experience in internal control, preferably in production and retail environments.
	Strong understanding of risk management and process improvement.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Proficiency in audit tools and software (e.g., QuickBooks, Excel, etc.).
	High integrity and attention to detail.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: bunmi@teal-harmony.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
